historical:
Legislative History of Laws

For history of Law 19-86, see notes under ยง 15-361.

Uniform Law:

This section is based on ยง 2 of the Uniform Foreign-Country Money Judgments Recognition Act. See Vol. 13, Part II, Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition or ULA Database on Westlaw.

DC CODE ยง 15-362

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: "Foreign country" means a government other than:
The District of Columbia, a state, district, commonwealth, territory, or insular possession of the United States; or

Any other government with regard to which the decision in the District of Columbia as to whether to recognize a judgment of that government's courts is initially subject to determination under the Full Faith and Credit Clause of the United States Constitution.
"Foreign-country judgment" means a judgment of a court of a foreign country.

title.text: Judgments and Executions; Fees and Costs. (Refs & Annos)
